intro: Gratiola aurea f. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered yellow crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with white markings. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The inflorescence consists of a single flower per stem, which blooms in early spring.
